sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 14
sermons.description: The contrast between Abraham and Lot is a contrast between believers today.  Lot is a picture of a righteous man but one who chooses for himself, not trusting God to choose for him.  Melchizedek's coming on the scene into Abraham's life is a picture of the New Covenant priesthood of blessing others.

sermons.title: (Hebrews - Part 19): Melchizedek
sermons.description: Tozer is classic and part of a breed that has all but vanished. His clarity is profound in itself. He carefully places Melchizedek as the icon of change from a Priesthood of antiquity, to a Priesthood of Eternal purpose. He clearly separates Levi from Melchizedek and authenicates the acquisition of Christ as our Great High Priest thus forever ending the Levitical priesthood.

sermons.title: (The Better Covenant) 1 - A Loving Father
sermons.description: All of our problems arise from our lack of awareness of God as our Father.  What revolutionizes my life is knowing that the Father loves me as much as He loves Jesus!  The quality of life described in the new covenant is distinctively better than that of the old covenant, as high as Jesus is above Moses.  Living in the superior provision of the new covenant is having a Father as Jesus did, not a policeman full of rules and regulations.

sermons.title: Able to Save to the Uttermost
sermons.description: A look at our intercessor: (1) the need of an intercessor, (2) the qualifications of our intercessor, (3) the subjects of his intercession, (4) the results of his intercession, (5) the objects of his intercession.

sermons.title: Christ As Our Priest
sermons.description: One part of Jesus' priestly work was to make atonement for the sins of His people. 1-Why do sins have to be taken out of the way for God to be at peace with sinners? 2-What did Jesus do to take our sins out of the way?

sermons.title: Finding Life Beyond The Grave
sermons.description: April 12, 2009 - There are a lot of people who want to hear the truth about Jesus but they don't want to embrace that truth. God offers a personal relationship to all who desire Him with a sincere heart. When you come with a sincere heart the first thing you will see is His mercy. As you behold the mercy of God and the promises of God you will be changed into a new person. God longs to give you something deeper than a casual relationship. He longs to give you something deeper than just knowing some facts about Him. Have the courage to go deeper and come home to God today!

sermons.title: Growing in the Grace of God #21 - A Covenant of Better Promises Part 1
Growing in the Grace of God #22 - A Covenant of Better Promises Part 2
He is able (1 of 2) - 1955
sermons.description: "There are texts that leap out of the thicket and they seize hold of you, they have something in them, at least for that moment, that is transcending everything else" Ravenhill says of his choice of texts. Why? This text is as fathomless as the ocean, and is the despair of devils simply because it brings out the glory of Jesus Christ. This sermon is simply gospel preaching from an old order. Hear Ravenhill as you very rarely will, and gain a much deeper and fuller understanding of the Gospel of full salvation.

sermons.title: He is able (2 of 2) - 1955
sermons.description: "There are texts that leap out of the thicket and they seize hold of you, they have something in them, at least for that moment, that is transcending everything else" Ravenhill says of his choice of texts. Why? This text is as fathomless as the ocean, and is the despair of devils simply because it brings out the glory of Jesus Christ. This sermon is simply gospel preaching from an old order. Hear Ravenhill as you very rarely will, and gain a much deeper and fuller understanding of the Gospel of full salvation.

sermons.title: Spiritual Perfection Through The Mediator Of The New Covenant
sermons.description: "You will automatically fulfill everything God has created and redeemed you to be as you lay hold of Him!" proclaims Ed Miller.  Brother Ed beautifully simplifies complex truths about spiritual perfection and the new covenant and relates them to living union to Christ, as a body to its head.  The burden of the message is to practically show how Christians are to grow spiritually in vital connection with Jesus.
